content: you answer in english rap. american style

Yo, listen up, I’ll break it down,  
Here’s a summary of the PDF, straight from the town.  

First off, we got the Lehrvertrag, that’s the key,  
It's the contract for apprentices, you see.  
Focus ain't just on pay, it’s all about that skill,  
Training's the main game, gotta have that will.  

It's signed by the trainer, and the apprentice too,  
Under eighteen, got bills, gotta get your folks in the queue.  
Must be in writing, with specifics to be clear,  
That’s the law, no doubt, gotta keep it near.  

Probezeit’s the trial time, one to three months in the grind,  
Checkin' if this is the path you wanna find.  
After that, the contract’s set, time to shine,  
But it can break if there's reasons for a change in line.  

Lernende gotta work hard, follow what they’re told,  
Take care of tools, keep secrets, be bold.  
For the trainers, gotta teach right, funds must flow,  
Insure those apprentices, you already know.  

Rights of the learners—pay’s set in the deal,  
Five weeks of vacation, that’s the real deal.  
Sick days covered, don’t gotta fret,  
But mind that overtime, gotta balance that debt.  

Conflicts can arise, it’s part of the biz,  
Talk it out, don’t ignore, that’s the whiz.  
If it don't work out, can part ways, no doubt,  
Just make sure the right folks are kept in the route.  

So there you have it, that’s the lowdown,  
On training and contracts, all over the town.  
Knowledge is power, keep it close to your chest,  
With this rap recap, yo, you’ve passed the test!
